subject: Learning
title: The Google Effect on Memory
description: A quick win: understand The Google Effect on Memory.

hook.text: Why memorize anything when you can just Google it? Because your brain doesn't work that way.

buildup.text: The Google Effect describes the tendency to forget information you believe you can look up later.

discovery.text: Studies show people remember where to find info better than the information itself when Google is available.

twist.text: But thinking requires accessible knowledge. You can't Google-search mid-thought to form connections.

climax.text: Knowledge in your head enables inference, creativity, and critical thinking. Knowledge online doesn't.

punchline.text: You can't think with knowledge you don't have.

quiz.question: What is the Google Effect on memory?
options: People forget information they believe they can look up online
Google improves memory by providing more information
